introduction: This video discusses the performance implications of using SELECT \* when querying a table in a relational database. The speaker explains the reasons behind the slow performance of SELECT \* and dives into the details of how the database engine processes such queries.

sections.title: Section 1: Understanding SELECT \*
content: Explanation of the purpose of the video and the topic being covered.
Discussion of the performance issues associated with using SELECT \*.
Explanation of how the database engine processes SELECT \* queries.
Importance of understanding the performance implications of SELECT \*.

sections.title: Section 2: Full Table Scan
content: Explanation of the full table scan process.
Discussion of the performance impact of full table scans.
Explanation of how indexes can improve query performance.
Importance of using indexes in database queries.

sections.title: Section 3: Deserialization Cost
content: Explanation of deserialization cost in the context of SELECT \* queries.
Discussion of the impact of deserialization cost on query performance.
Explanation of how to reduce deserialization cost.
Importance of considering deserialization cost in database queries.

sections.title: Section 4: Lazy Data Retrieval
content: Explanation of lazy data retrieval and its benefits.
Discussion of how lazy data retrieval can improve query performance.
Explanation of how to implement lazy data retrieval in database queries.
Importance of considering lazy data retrieval in database design.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion
content: Summary of the key points covered in the video.
Discussion of the importance of understanding performance implications in database queries.
Final thoughts and recommendations for optimizing database performance.
Call to action for viewers to apply the concepts learned in the video.
